alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Lee; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:48PM EDT until July 01 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN HARNETT...NORTHEASTERN LEE...SOUTHWESTERN WAKE AND EASTERN CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 548 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Cary to 8 miles northwest of Fuquay-Varina to 9 miles northeast of Sanford, moving southeast at 35 mph. This storm has a history of producing widespread tree damage in Alamance County. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Sanford, Pittsboro, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Angier, Apex, Holly Springs and Morrisville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
